task.name: hif_gaincal
task.shortdescription: Determine temporal gains from calibrator observations
task.description:
The complex gains are derived from the data column (raw data) divided by the model column (usually set with hif_setjy). The gains are obtained for a specified solution interval, spw combination and field combination.
Good candidate reference antennas can be determined using the hif_refant task.
Previous calibrations that have been stored in the pipeline context are applied on the fly. Users can interact with these calibrations via the h_export_calstate and h_import_calstate tasks.
Output
results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.

param.name: vis
param.shortdescription: List of input MeasurementSets
param.description:
The list of input MeasurementSets. Defaults to the list of MeasurementSets specified in the h_init or hif_importdata task. '': use all MeasurementSets in the context
Examples: 'ngc5921.ms', ['ngc5921a.ms', ngc5921b.ms', 'ngc5921c.ms']

param.name: caltable
param.shortdescription: List of output caltables
param.description:
The list of output calibration tables. Defaults to the standard pipeline naming convention.
Example: caltable=['M82.gcal', 'M82B.gcal']

param.name: field
param.shortdescription: Set of data selection field names or ids
param.description:
The list of field names or field ids for which gain solutions are to be computed. Defaults to all fields with the standard intent.
Example: field='3C279', field='3C279, M82'

param.name: intent
param.shortdescription: Set of data selection observing intents
param.description:
A string containing a comma delimited list of intents against which the selected fields are matched. Defaults to *PHASE*.
Examples: intent='', intent='*AMP*,*PHASE*'

param.name: spw
param.shortdescription: Set of data selection spectral window/channels
param.description:
The list of spectral windows and channels for which gain solutions are computed. Defaults to all science spectral windows.
Examples: spw='3C279', spw='3C279, M82'

param.name: antenna
param.shortdescription: Set of data selection antenna ids
param.description: Set of data selection antenna ids

param.name: hm_gaintype
param.shortdescription: The gain solution type (gtype or gspline)
param.description: The type of gain calibration. The options are 'gtype' and 'gspline' for CASA gain types = 'G' and 'GSPLINE' respectively.

param.name: calmode
param.shortdescription: Type of solution (ap, p, a)
param.description:
Type of solution. The options are 'ap' (amp and phase), 'p' (phase only) and 'a' (amp only).
Examples: calmode='p', calmode='a', calmode='ap'

param.name: solint
param.shortdescription: Solution intervals
param.description:
Time solution intervals in CASA syntax. Works for hm_gaintype='gtype' only.
Examples: solint='inf', solint='int', solint='100sec'

param.name: combine
param.shortdescription: Data axes which to combine for solve (scan, spw, and/or field)
param.description: Data axes to combine for solving. Options are '', 'scan', 'spw', 'field' or any comma-separated combination. Works for hm_gaintype='gtype' only.

param.name: refant
param.shortdescription: Reference antenna names
param.description:
Reference antenna name(s) in priority order. Defaults to most recent values set in the pipeline context. If no reference antenna is defined in the pipeline context use the CASA defaults.
Examples: refant='DV01', refant='DV05,DV07'

param.name: refantmode
param.shortdescription: Reference antenna selection mode
param.description:
Controls how the refant is applied. Currently available choices are 'flex', 'strict', and the default value of ''. Setting to '' allows the pipeline to select the appropriate mode based on the state of the reference antenna list.
Examples: refantmode='strict', refantmode=''

param.name: solnorm
param.shortdescription: Normalize average solution amplitudes to 1.0
param.description: Normalize average solution amplitudes to 1.0

param.name: minblperant
param.shortdescription: Minimum baselines per antenna required for solve
param.description: Minimum number of baselines required per antenna for each solve. Antennas with fewer baselines are excluded from solutions. Works for hm_gaintype='gtype' only.

param.name: minsnr
param.shortdescription: Reject solutions below this SNR
param.description: Solutions below this SNR are rejected. Works for hm_gaintype='channel' only.

param.name: smodel
param.shortdescription: Point source Stokes parameters for source model
param.description:
Point source Stokes parameters for source model (experimental). Defaults to using standard MODEL_DATA column data.
Example: smodel=[1,0,0,0] - (I=1, unpolarized)

param.name: splinetime
param.shortdescription: Spline timescale(sec)
param.description: Spline timescale (sec). Used for hm_gaintype='gspline'. Typical splinetime should cover about 3 to 5 calibrator scans.

param.name: npointaver
param.shortdescription: The phase-unwrapping algorithm
param.description: Tune phase-unwrapping algorithm. Used for hm_gaintype='gspline'. Keep at default value.

param.name: phasewrap
param.shortdescription: Wrap the phase for jumps greater than this value (degrees)
param.description: Wrap the phase for changes larger than this amount (degrees). Used for hm_gaintype='gspline'. Keep at default value.

param.name: pipelinemode
param.shortdescription: The pipeline operating mode
param.description: The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In 'interactive' mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.

param.name: dryrun
param.shortdescription: Run the task (False) or just display the command (True)
param.description: Run the task (False) or just display the command (True)

param.name: acceptresults
param.shortdescription: Add the results to the pipeline context
param.description: Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False).

task.example:
Compute standard per scan gain solutions that will be used to calibrate the target:
hif_gaincal()
